alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 3:18AM CST until February 20 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Clay County. In North Dakota, Cass County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Heavy snow rates and patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and best chance for blowing snow will be Monday afternoon and evening after the snow ends.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
